intro: Seseli paphlagonicum, commonly known as the Paphlagonian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided, giving it a feathery appearance, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
